file_content.text: Have fun with the Mandalorians. I hear they're real easy to talk to.
Margok is losing his mind over you!
Let's hit those Blades where it counts--in the profits.
Welcome back!
You've achieved more in your short time here than we ever thought possible. You should be proud.
That's kind of you to say. Perhaps working together like this means there's hope for a more peaceful future.
Thank you, Lana.
Perhaps so.
What I achieve, I do through patience and the guidance of the Force. You could do the same, if you chose to.
You could be like me, too.
I'll take your attempt to convert me as a compliment.
I didn't achieve all of this. We did. Working together.
Teamwork was the key.
Perhaps a sign of better things to come.
I'm usually pretty modest, but just this once I'll admit it: I am the most amazing person alive.
You're right: I'm awesome.
Hah!
I think seeing that smile of yours is a much better achievement for the day.
[Flirt] I'm glad you're happy.
Now you're just teasing me....
Then you understand why the Jedi are going to win this war in the end.
This is why Jedi are superior.
Come now. We're working together so well--why ruin it?
Say whatever you want--I'm never going to forget who and what you are.
I don't want your praise.
Rather a strong grudge for a Jedi.
Compliments from a Sith don't mean much. Save your breath.
I don't want your praise.
If you say so....
A compliment from the killer Sith Lord! I'm touched. Really.
I don't want your praise.
Have it your way....
Droid! They're all just standing around talking. You said this would be a party!
I also said we should stop for decorations on the way! Now the party's terrible, and it's our fault as much as theirs!
Hey. Slicing the Nova Blade files is slow going, but I've already found more references to this Torch person that Margok and Revan were talking about.
She definitely heads up a group of Mandalorians based here on Rishi. They were allied with the Revanites, but then broke ties--and not on good terms.
If we can find Torch and get her talking, she might give us some good intel. Maybe even help us take the Revanites on.
I've fought my share of Mandalorians. It would be nice to have some on our side for a change.
Sounds good to me.
Agreed.
We don't know anything for sure yet. It's best to be cautious when it comes to Mandalorians.
Let's not get our hopes up.
Fair enough.
These people kill for credits. They're more trouble than they're worth.
Mandos can't be trusted.
I think that's a risk worth taking, don't you? Otherwise we're just sitting around here waiting for the computer to finish.
It looks like Torch and her crew control their own island not far from here. Think you could head over and see what she has to say?
I'll contact you once I've found Torch. Let me know as soon as you pull anything else out of the Nova Blade files.
Right away.
You got it. Good luck.
Well, since you asked so nicely....
[Flirt] For you? Anything.
Stay safe out there, all right?
This is going to end badly. Wait and see.
Got a bad feeling about this....
I'm sure you can handle one aging crew of Mandalorians.
Get some drinks while you're out! This party won't get better on its own....
I got the slaves off of the island.
We heard. Word of your raids is going around fast. Even the Revanites have heard about the great Red Hulls.
We just intercepted this transmission from the Nova Blades' headquarters.
This is ridiculous! How am I supposed to hold up our part of the deal if you won't give us any backup when we're in trouble?
Then perhaps we should seek other allies. I'm sure there are other crews on this planet who are capable of managing their own affairs.
Hey, we've done our share! You wanted the shipping lanes raided, we raided 'em! You wanted stragglers picked off from the big battles, we did it!
And your clumsiness cost us our Mandalorian allies.
Torch and her crew of old fossils? We're better off without 'em.
And I'm beginning to think we're better off without you. Deal with your own problems if you want to prove otherwise.
We have Revan and his followers fooled. We'd better move quickly--if they cut the Nova Blades out, there may not be any information left to recover.
The plan worked perfectly.
I agree. Speed is essential now.
Do you know anything about the Mandalorians they mentioned?
They mentioned Mandalorians....
I've heard people around town mention Torch, but I didn't realize she was tied to the Blades or the Revanites. Might be a good lead for later.
Right now, though, I think we should press our advantage against the Nova Blades.
So that was Revan? Somehow, I expected more.
Revan doesn't look so scary.
If we keep this up, Revan won't have anyone left to keep his secrets.
Revan's running out of friends.
He's managed to do a lot. I don't think it's wise to count him out just yet.
We'll deal with Revan soon enough. For now, we should focus on the Nova Blades.
Agreed.
The Nova Blades are based out of an old crashed warship: the Aggressor. You've probably seen it, off in the distance.
You need to hit them hard--make it look like the goal is to completely crush them, so nobody notices when we raid their computer cores for intel.
Jakarro is refueling his ship as we speak. While you approach the Aggressor, you can use your target designator to call for his assistance, just like before.
I'll contact you as soon as I reach the Aggressor. And then we can finally get the answers we need.
Our enemy is cornered, but not helpless. I'll proceed cautiously and contact you when I reach the Aggressor.
May the Force be with you.
Understood. Once I'm ready to breach the Aggressor, I'll contact you.
Sounds like fun. I'll get in touch when I hit the Aggressor, so you can start putting together a victory party at the cantina.
Let's not get ahead of ourselves.
Good luck.
The Nova Blades have a pretty good setup here. They're not gonna enjoy watching it crumble.
Hey there.
Theron? Lana? You're the ones behind all of this?
Guilty as charged. Sorry if we put you out, but we had to be cautious.
The Revanites have gone to increasingly severe lengths to hunt us down since we destroyed their operations on Rakata Prime.
We had to get you here to help us without leaving a trail. Sorry we couldn't be more... direct.
I'm sure you wouldn't have done all of this without a good reason. What have you found?
Better safe than sorry.
What made you decide to pull me into all of this?
Why me?
I'd been hoping to recruit your help with this problem for quite a while, actually. Your record speaks for itself.
And, as it happens, our list of trustworthy allies is rather short at the moment.
Let's get started.
I can't decide which of you is happier to see me. Want to help me out?
[Flirt] So, who missed me more?
Uhh....
...Moving on....
After all of this time, I was starting to think you didn't care.
[Flirt] Did you miss me, Theron?
Is that a fact? What are you thinking now?
After so long, I started to think you'd run back to the Empire without even saying goodbye.
[Flirt] Did you miss me, Lana?
I wouldn't dream of it.
All right, let's focus here.
Intriguing spies don't lure me into secret missions nearly as often as I'd like.
[Flirt] No problem, Theron.
Happy to be of service.
Shall we focus, please?
Do you have any idea what I've had to deal with? This planet is a madhouse!
"Sorry" won't cut it!
Oh? We've been watching your progress--I think you're selling yourself a bit short.
Honestly, it's too bad you never pursued thuggery as a profession. You're taking to it quite well.
I can see why you chose your profession. You take to these underworld sorts quite naturally.
We need to go after the pirates that run things on Rishi--the Nova Blades.
They butcher entire starship crews and enslave anyone on Rishi who stands up to them. And now we've learned that they're working with the Revanites.
The Nova Blades are being sent to attack trade lanes in very specific areas. They've gradually remapped quite a bit of stellar traffic. It's all very strange.
We may not know the Revanites' exact plan. But the pirates will.
Then let's find the truth.
Exactly.
You believe there's more to their plan than raiding or financial gain.
You suspect a larger plan.
We're certain of it. We just can't find the pattern.
Using the pirates instead of their own troops keeps their goals obscured.
A false flag campaign?
Exactly. We need to figure out what those goals are.
The Revanites have some major expenses. Maybe the pirates are just helping them cover costs.
Everybody needs credits.
That may well be part of it. But there's more... a pattern, though we can't determine its purpose.
Our team isn't exactly normal.
No one would expect a Jedi, a Sith, and a spy to work together, but here we are.
They've got Revanites and pirates, we've got Special Forces, a covert agent, and a Sith lord. I think we've got them beat in the "strange" department.
Revanites teaming up with pirates isn't any weirder than our little group. A smuggler, a spy, and a Sith lord... sounds like the set-up for a good joke, actually....
Circumstance alone brought us together. The Revanites chose their allies very specifically. We must learn why.
So, in all your time here, you've learned that some pirates are doing some raiding. Top-notch work.
This is all you've found?
They aren't raiding for themselves--that's the point. They could be making far more credits elsewhere. This is all the Revanites' doing.
We need to shake the Nova Blades down, find out what they know. Their computers could tell us everything.
But a direct attack on the Blades' base now might make the Revanites suspicious. We need to hide our real motives.
So that's why you told everyone I'm a pirate. When I attack them, it will look like a fight between gangs, instead of a targeted move.
Exactly. Now, before we send you for the main event, we should hit a few other Nova Blade holdings to solidify the cover story.
The Blades have a supply cache hidden nearby. Once the "Red Hulls" have destroyed it, word should spread quickly.
We have some... mutual friends who are excited to help with the task. They'll meet you in the field to settle the details.
Jakarro and Ceetoo Deefour?
The very same.
Theron and I have a pair of... associates... who will be aiding you in this task. They'll meet you in the field with more details.
Can I trust them?
With information? Yes, they know everything we do. They can get a little carried away, though.
While you're hitting the supply cache, we'll keep spreading the word about your "grudge" and see if we can find any other targets. Sound good?
I'll get out there right away.
Sounds good.
Just be sure you don't make things too colorful. People think I'm bad enough as it is.
Don't exaggerate too much.
I think going after the Nova Blades should increase your popularity quite a bit.
You two have put me through quite a bit already. This had better go smoothly.
This plan better work.
That's the spirit....
Good luck.
Theron? Lana? I didn't expect to find you here.
Our situation became rather grave after the operation on Manaan.
We tracked Colonel Darok and Darth Arkous to a facility on Rakata Prime. They were going to mass-produce the cyborgs they developed in their research lab.
Jakarro and Deefour helped us defeat them, but we still barely escaped with our lives. And we discovered that Darok and Arkous weren't the ones in charge.
Revan is alive. Apparently, he's the one running the whole show. He's got some kind of grand plan, and Rishi is a part of it--that's why we're here.
I was there when we freed Revan from an Imperial prison. Why has he turned on us?
Revan was an ally of the Republic--why would he turn against us?
I wish I knew.
Theron Shan... so you're behind all of this.
Afraid so. Things have gotten... complicated... since we last spoke.
You remember our conversation in the cantina? How the attacks on Tython and Korriban seemed suspicious? I tracked down the truth.
Colonel Darok was a traitor--and he wasn't the only one. The Republic and the Empire have both been infiltrated by members of the Order of Revan.
That's why I'm here. Lana Beniko.
A Sith?
Not in good standing, if that's at all reassuring. This cult is a threat to the Empire as well as the Republic. They've infiltrated the highest levels of both our governments.
At first, we thought Colonel Darok and his Imperial accomplice were in charge. We even destroyed an operation they had going on the planet Rakata Prime. That's where we uncovered their real leader.
Who are you?
My name is Theron Shan. I'm an agent for the Strategic Information Service... or used to be, anyway.
The Republic has been infiltrated. The Empire, too. Both sides are being manipulated by a secret cult: the Order of Revan.
The Aggressor must have been quite a ship, back when it could actually fly.
I doubt the Nova Blades set up all of this data security on their own. The Revanites must've given them a helping hand. This is going to take a while....
Barsen'thor, I'm glad to see you.
Masters Bestros and Gnost-Dural send their best--we miss your insight on the Jedi Council.
I miss the Council's debates, Grand Master. But alas, Tython isn't where I'm needed.
Always a pleasure, Satele.
We have a lot to discuss.
Why do I have the feeling the Council prefers me at a distance?
I doubt anyone's missed me.
I couldn't say. You're always welcome on Tython--even when there's not an invasion.
Master Satele, a lot has happened since we last spoke...
I've heard rumors. But I can't guarantee this channel is secure, so I'd rather you safeguard your secrets. Just listen.
The Jedi Council must do more than react to crises--we must see to the future of the Order and the Republic.
What we've seen in war, the truths we've learned, will be our gift to later generations. And few Jedi have seen or learned more than you.
Our understanding of the Esh-kha, the Emperor's Children, even the shielding technique that defeated Terrak Morrhage--it could all be lost if we take no pains to preserve it.
You want my lore preserved...
I've done no more than any Jedi. You were there at the war's beginning, you rediscovered Tython....
I'm nothing special.
Years ago. And humility is no virtue when it blinds.
Worrying about our legacy seems premature when we may not survive to leave one.
We have more urgent concerns.
Then why are we Jedi? Or put that aside, and think of your own evolution.
In truth, you are becoming one of the greatest Force users our Order has ever seen. You stand witness to our era's conflicts.
But to reach your full potential, you must test yourself--and there's one trial you've yet to undertake.
You want me to construct a holocron.
Yes. You've contributed to holocrons before, but we need a full archive of your history, your thoughts--a record to continue all your life, as you grow, learn and change.
As you said, we have a duty to the future, and I feel the burden keenly. But I've had no opportunities to act.
I've been thinking about it.
How do you suggest I proceed, Master Satele?
I don't object--but why a holocron instead of a written record? It would certainly be simpler.
What makes holocrons special?
A holocron is attuned to the Force. When you unlocked the Noetikons on Coruscant, would a document have sufficed instead?
My ways aren't traditional Jedi ways. Are you sure you want them passed down?
You may not like my teachings.
Your ways have earned my respect, if not my understanding. Let posterity be our judge.
I've granted the request of Master Kutri O'a to seek you out. He is a prophet and a master of the holocron's craft.
He wishes to aid you in the device's construction. He's come to Rishi, believing the Force has willed it. You might be flattered.
Where is he?
I'll send coordinates.
You have much to offer our successors, and much to learn. Do what you must, and may the Force be with you.
Everything you just heard? It's important. Remember it.
But... it can wait a little while. There's something I want you to see.
Who's there?
Follow your feelings, and you'll find it.
Well, if it isn't the Voidhound himself.
You know, I ran into your pirates on Port Nowhere. It's cute how they fight to be your favorite.
You know there's a Republic representative to Port Nowhere, now? It's almost like you cleaned up the place.
You know, no one believed me on Port Nowhere when I said we'd met. Probably good for your rep.
Beryl Thorn. Still sore about Taris?
Most of the bruises are gone, so only a little.
Look, I saw you were around, and against my better judgment I thought I'd call.
Beryl Thorn. How long's it been? Since Quesh?
Let's not talk about Quesh. I still have a rash from the fumes.
Look, I saw you were on Rishi and thought I'd run something past you.
An opportunity's come up. How would you like to make a fortune together?
Been a while since I had an offer like that. You know I'm in.
Do you even need to ask?
Good, because I'm out a crew and this is a two-person job, minimum.
Make a fortune together, smuggle core samples together... whatever you need me for.
[Flirt] For you? Always.
Just the fortune for today.
Swing by my ship and we'll talk. Beryl out.
You never struck me as the get-rich-quick type. More the practical, helpful, scary-when-she's-cornered type.
You're awfully confident.
Thanks, I guess. But this is something I've been thinking about awhile.
Normally I'd love to, but the galaxy needs saving and I'm apparently the only one who knows how.
I'm a little busy right now.
You're really committed to this whole protector-of-the-Republic bit, aren't you? Come on, you can make a little time. Might even broaden your horizons.
I'll be at my ship. Meet me if you want.
Well, if it isn't the Voidhound herself.
Major. I understand Havoc is engaged on Rishi without official orders.
General Garza. It's complicated, sir...
I don't need an explanation. I need you to place your mission on hold and rendezvous near the spaceport.
Something's come up. I'll brief you in person.
Please confirm, General. You're going to rendezvous with Havoc on Rishi?
You're coming here?
Not with Havoc--with you. I'll explain everything shortly.
What's going on, General? I haven't received orders from you since Corellia.
It's been a long time, sir.
I'm happy to discuss that, Major--in person.
This signal is encrypted, but the longer we talk the more likely it is to be tracked. Understood?
Understood, sir.
Good. Garza out.
With due respect, sir, I've uncovered evidence of a conspiracy inside Republic ranks.
This seems suspicious.
Until that's dealt with, it might be safer for us to keep our distance from one another.
I know what you're suggesting, Major, and I don't like it. I am still your commanding officer, and I am ordering you to these coordinates.
Anything else we'll need to discuss in person. This signal is encrypted, but if we talk longer it will be tracked. Garza out.
